transcription.text: So I want to speak today about what I think will be the broad architecture of the decentralized

It really isn't much of an open web anymore.
Google's front end serves and monetizes everyone else's content.
Facebook, Twitter, and a bunch of other gardens have us trapped behind their walls.
It didn't start that way.
The internet started with the promise of a certain style of decentralization.
It was about building robust network architectures such that damage to one part of the network
would not render other parts unusable.
The socially aware technologist soon framed this characteristic of decentralization in
the context of political control.
John Gilmore, an early famous cipherpunk, stated that the net interpret censorship is

These early cipherpunks were the godparents of all of us here today.

Amazon's, and Apple's ecosystems and the various Facebook properties.

Without a native construct for money, the web turned to advertising as its core business

Without a native construct for secure and private identity, the web grew exploitative

patient.
With deep learning techniques applied to monetizing our personal information and our attention

Having identified some nasty problems in the command and control architecture of the web,

These solutions are not yet mature, but they point the way to a web and societal future

This is why 4,000 of us flew to the kitchen of Japan to celebrate and extend the current
capabilities of Ethereum.
The promising solutions involve decentralized protocol technology.
These solutions will soon employ zero knowledge techniques pervasively and systematically.
So only what must be disclosed in a given situation will be shared.
Whether you are demonstrating that you are of legal age to walk into a bar without also
having to reveal your home address or demonstrating that you are capable of shipping a certain

These solutions involve tokenized, incentivized collaboration mechanisms.
Instead of a world of companies that serve customers in a somewhat adversarial relationship,
we will soon conduct our lives on networks for commerce and leisure.
These networks will bring together many actors in diverse roles and motivate activity with
tokenized mechanism design such that the collective collaborative behavior that emerges
on each platform serves all the people who operate on and jointly own and govern the

As the platform appreciates in value, all the owners playing different roles on the platform

These solutions will see us establish our own self-sauver identities where we control the

Perhaps most importantly, W3C will be more user-centric than any previous internet platform, putting

People must be in control of the root of their identities so that their identity can't be

Even in the extreme circumstance where a refugee is deplatformed from their country and not

to easily access their decentralized identity and reclaim their personal portable history
and reputation.
In the form of verifiable claims linked to that DID.
Under the W3 paradigm, all users will have real agency, social, political and economic

This will be the new fabric of society and this fabric will support far broader participation

world.

Privacy and confidentiality, scalability and usability.

Facebook, Twitter and YouTube now have enormous ability to shape narratives, debate and broad

And there's platform risk to startups and other companies who find the rules of a platform

the companies that it drew in as partners a few years earlier.
The incessant drive to grow revenue once at the top of its adoption curve yields such

Google, Amazon, Facebook, LinkedIn, Apple and Microsoft are all large platforms that

AWS and some Asian cloud providers have been accused for a while of rewriting, reusing,

Others would argue that there's an implicit social contract and that companies like Amazon

This kind of anti-competitive behavior is enabled by vertical integration.
I believe the web3 world will be largely horizontally layered with explicit interface promises between

Blockchain networks will better account for possible negative externalities and bring

Forks effectively keep those exiting within the broader tent, enabling the extended community

I am powerfully focused on maximal decentralization, permissionless, the base trust layer that

But I think it is short sighted when some people believe that all blockchain systems must be
fully permissionless and maximally decentralized.
When you are issuing valuable assets or anchoring into a base trust layer, that layer must be

But adding some decentralization to use cases that are enacted among a small set of counter

now.
A commodity trade finance platform, for instance, linking banks and commodity traders does not

From 2020, it may make sense to link that commodity trade finance platform laterally
into a commodities trading platform and into a payments platform and into a corporate identity

These networks can be linked to one another laterally using bridges or using the liquidity

The quality already links Ethereum and Bitcoin, trustlessly.
And by 2021, it may make sense to anchor all those platforms down into the Ethereum
base trust layer for increased security without sacrificing scalability and also so that the
base layer can serve as a trustworthy message and transaction bus between a wide variety

This suggests that the architecture of the decentralized worldwide web will look like

Some possibly private and permissioned, linked to one another and anchored down into the
